meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Court Proceedings (Electronic Technology) (District Court) (Electronic Fees) Rules

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: concessionary period (寬減期) means the period of 5 years beginning on the earliest date specified under section 32(2) of the Ordinance in relation to the District Court; (L.N. 188 of 2022)
DC Fees Rules (《區院費用規則》) means the District Court (Fees) Rules (Cap. 336 sub. leg. C);
EA Regulation (《地產代理規例》) means the Estate Agents (Registration of Determination and Appeal) Regulation (Cap. 511 sub. leg. E);
LT Fees Rules (《審裁處費用規則》) means the Labour Tribunal (Fees) Rules (Cap. 25 sub. leg. B);
RDC (《區院規則》) means the Rules of the District Court (Cap. 336 sub. leg. H);
Registrar (司法常務官) has the meaning given by section 2 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336);
Registry (登記處) means the registry of the District Court.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.content: These Rules apply in relation to a court-related matter that is carried out by means of an e-system.

part.name: P3
part.heading: e-fees Payable for Certain Proceedings in District Court

section.name: s4
section.heading: e-fees payable for District Court civil proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (2), the following e-fee is payable for a court-related matter described in column 2 (relevant matter)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during a period other than the concessionary period—the DC civil fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the concessionary period—a fee of an amount equivalent to 80% of the DC civil fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter.

subsection.content: No e-fee is payable for item 4(a) of Part 1 of the Schedule.
In this rule, a reference to a column is a reference to a column of Part 1 of the Schedule.

subsection.def: DC civil fee (區院民事費用), in relation to an item, means a fee specified or described for the item in Part 1 of the Schedule to the DC Fees Rules.

section.name: s5
section.heading: e-fees payable for District Court criminal proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (2), the following e-fee is payable for a court-related matter described in column 2 (relevant matter)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during a period other than the concessionary period—the DC criminal fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the concessionary period—a fee of an amount equivalent to 80% of the DC criminal fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter.

subsection.content: No e-fee is payable for item 2(a) of Part 2 of the Schedule.
In this rule, a reference to a column is a reference to a column of Part 2 of the Schedule.

subsection.def: DC criminal fee (區院刑事費用), in relation to an item, means a fee specified for the item in Part 2 of the Schedule to the DC Fees Rules.

section.name: s6
section.heading: e-fees payable for proceedings under Part III of Cap. 7

subsection.leadIn: The following e-fee is payable for distraint for rent under Part III of Cap. 7—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during a period other than the concessionary period—the distraint fee specified for the sum sued for;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the concessionary period—a fee of an amount equivalent to 80% of the distraint fee specified for the sum sued for.

subsection.def: Cap. 7 (《第7章》) means the Landlord and Tenant (Consolidation) Ordinance (Cap. 7);
distraint fee (財物扣押費) means a fee specified under the column headed “Fee for every affidavit, warrant to distrain, notice or other document” in the Fourth Schedule to Cap. 7.

section.name: s7
section.heading: e-fees in relation to Labour Tribunal proceedings

subsection.leadIn: The following e-fee is payable for a court-related matter described in column 2 (relevant matter)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during a period other than the concessionary period—the LT fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the concessionary period—a fee of an amount equivalent to 80% of the LT fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter.

subsection.content: In this rule, a reference to a column is a reference to a column in Part 3 of the Schedule.

subsection.def: LT fee (審裁處費用), in relation to an item, means a fee specified for the item in the Schedule to the LT Fees Rules.

section.name: s8
section.heading: e-fees in relation to proceedings under EA Regulation

subsection.leadIn: The following e-fee is payable for a court-related matter described in column 2 (relevant matter)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during a period other than the concessionary period—the EA fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the concessionary period—a fee of an amount equivalent to 80% of the EA fee for the item that bears the item number specified in column 3 opposite to the relevant matter.

subsection.content: In this rule, a reference to a column is a reference to a column in Part 4 of the Schedule.

subsection.def: EA fee (地產代理費用), in relation to an item, means a fee specified for the item in Schedule 2 to the EA Regulation.

section.name: s8A
section.heading: e-fees payable for applications for certified copies of Hong Kong Judgments
section.leadIn: The following e-fee is payable for an application under section 33(1) of the Mainland Judgments in Civil and Commercial Matters (Reciprocal Enforcement) Ordinance (Cap. 645)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during a period other than the concessionary period—the prescribed fee mentioned in section 33(2)(b) of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the concessionary period—a fee of an amount equivalent to 80% of that prescribed fee.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Rounding rule for e-fees payable during concessionary period

subsection.content: A concessionary fee that is less than $5 must be rounded to the nearest 10 cents.
A concessionary fee that is $5 or more but less than $10 must be rounded to the nearest 50 cents.
A concessionary fee that is $10 or more but less than $100 must be rounded to the nearest whole dollar.
A concessionary fee that is $100 or more but less than $1,000 and is not a multiplier of $5 must be rounded to the nearest multiplier of $5.
A concessionary fee that is $1,000 or more but less than $10,000 and is not a multiplier of $10 must be rounded to the nearest multiplier of $10.
A concessionary fee that is $10,000 or more but less than $100,000 and is not a multiplier of $50 must be rounded to the nearest multiplier of $50.
A concessionary fee that is $100,000 or more and is not a multiplier of $100 must be rounded to the nearest multiplier of $100.

subsection.def: concessionary fee (寬減費用) means the e-fee payable under rule 4(1)(b), 5(1)(b), 6(1)(b), 7(1)(b), 8(1)(b) or 8A(b). (L.N. 114 of 2024)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Specific fee payable instead of general fee
section.content: If an e-fee is specified specifically for a court-related matter, that fee is payable in substitution for and not in addition to any other general e-fee that is also payable for the matter.

subsection.content: The Registrar may reduce, remit or defer payment of an e-fee as the Registrar considers appropriate in a particular case.
If the Registrar exercises the power under subrule (1), the Registrar must endorse on the relevant document a note of the reduction, remission or deferment and the reason for it.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Fees Specified or Described in Part 1 of Schedule to DC Fees Rules

td.p: Corresponding item in Part 1 of Schedule to DC Fees Rules

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a writ of summons (except a concurrent, renewed or amended writ), per writ

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an originating summons, per summons

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an originating ex parte application, per application

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other originating document, per document

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Setting down a cause or issue for hearing

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Setting down a civil appeal, motion or summons for hearing

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Entering a reference for hearing of an assessment of damages by a judge or the Registrar

td.p: Copy of a document typed in the Registry and certifying same, per page

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Copy of a document obtained from an e-system

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Copy of a document made in the Registry and certification, per page

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Translation made in the Registry of a document from Chinese into English, or vice versa, including certificate, per page

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Transcription and translation made in the Registry from Chinese into English, or vice versa, of a tape or recording including certificate, per page

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Certifying translation made outside the Registry from Chinese into English, or vice versa, per page

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Certifying transcription made outside the Registry from Chinese into English, or vice versa, of a tape or recording, per page

td.p: Search in the Registry, for each document or file referred to or required

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a warrant for arrest of a defendant or for the attachment of property before judgment, per warrant

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a writ of execution or writ of possession, per writ

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a prohibitory order, per order

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an order for the examination of a judgment debtor (or an officer of a judgment debtor), per order

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a prohibition order, per order

td.p: On the filing of a notice of commencement of taxation under Order 62, rule 21(1) of the RDC or on any assessment or determination of costs pursuant to any court order or Ordinance (except assessment under Order 62, rule 9 or 9A of the RDC), for every $100 or fraction of $100 of the amount claimed
Withdrawal of a bill of costs within 7 days after the application for setting down the taxation under Order 62, rule 21A(1) of the RDC is made
Authentication of a document by the Registrar
On sealing a notice in Form No. 80 under Order 50, rule 11(2) of the RDC, per notice
On sealing an injunction order undertaken before commencement of a cause, per order

part.name: P2
part.heading: Fees Specified in Part 2 of Schedule to DC Fees Rules

td.p: Corresponding item in Part 2 of Schedule to DC Fees Rules
Copy of a document typed in the Registry and certifying same, per page

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Copy of a document obtained from an e-system

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Copy of a document made in the Registry and certification, per page

td.p: Search in the Registry, for each document or file referred to or required
Authentication of a document by the Registrar

part.name: P3
part.heading: Fees Specified in Schedule to LT Fees Rules

td.p: Corresponding item in Schedule to LT Fees Rules
Registration of an award or order with the District Court

part.name: P4
part.heading: Fees Specified in Schedule 2 to EA Regulation

td.p: Corresponding item in Schedule 2 to EA Regulation
Registration of a determination with the District Court
Filing of notice of appeal in the District Court
Copy of document in the register and certification for each page or portion of a page
